Description: Much of body with handle roots of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; glaze variously fired; interior glazed; two added white bands at mid-wall and traces of two white bands around rosette in added red and white in tondo; exterior: slip worn; painted decoration on one side only, sphinx (only trace of foreleg, hind leg and tail remaining) to left; below in handle zone, trace of double saw-edged metope pattern framed by groups of vertical strokes on either side of black handles; two bands on bowl and one at turn to foot; inscription on exterior;
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ11
Curator's comments: Φ11 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 679, no. 383)
Johnston 2006b / The Delta: From Gamma to Zeta (p.25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0884) (phase 2)
